intro: Paracephaelis sericea, commonly known as the silky paracephaelis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is notable for its soft, silvery-hairy foliage, which gives it its common name. It produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. Paracephaelis sericea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
